sen.j: 春香院（しゅんもじ、天正8年5月7日 (旧暦)（1580年6月18日） - 寛永18年11月20日 (旧暦)（1641年12月22日））は、前田利家と芳春院夫妻の六女で前田利長の実妹。
sen.e: Shunmoji (June 18, 1580 - December 22, 1641) was the sixth daughter of Toshiie MAEDA and Hoshunin, and the biological younger sister of Toshinaga MAEDA.

sen.j: 春香院は、1597年に細川忠興の嫡男細川忠隆と結婚するが、「故あって（義母細川ガラシャとともに自害しなかったことを指す）、慶長五年（1600年）に細川家から離縁。」（細川家記綿考輯録より）され、のち前田加賀八家のひとつでまつ（芳春院）の信頼が深い村井長頼の子村井長次に再嫁した（時期には異説がある。再婚時期の謎。）。
sen.e: Shunmoji married Tadataka HOSOKAWA, the legitimate son of Tadaoki HOSOKAWA, in 1597, but was 'divorced from the Hosokawa family in 1600 for a reason (she did not commit suicide with the mother-in-law, Garasha HOSOKAWA)' (according to Hosokawakeki menkoshuroku), and later remarried Nagatsugu MURAI, the son of Nagayori MURAI, who was one of the Maeda Kaga eight families, and deeply trusted by Matsu (Hoshunin) (There are different theories on the timing. Described later.).
sen.cmt: 「再婚時期の謎。」はWebにしたがい「後述。」として訳しました。

sen.j: 再嫁後の春香院と村井長次との間に実子はなかったものの、養子長光（実は織田長孝の子で、織田有楽斎の孫にあたる）をとり、1613年に長次が死去したあとは、落飾して村井家で春香院となり、穏やかな後半生を過ごした。
sen.e: After remarrying, Shunmoji did not have a biological child with Nagatsugu MURAI, but adopted Nagamitsu (who was in fact, the child of Nagataka ODA and grandchild of Urakusai ODA), and after the death of Nagatsugu in 1613, she went on to rakushoku (to take the tonsure and enter the priesthood) and became Shunmoji in the Murai family, and had a peaceful latter half of life.

sen.j: また、村井家石高は16,500石余で経済的にも恵まれており、春香院は村井長次死後に能登領熊甲神社の再建などもしている（岩沢愿彦著『前田利家』など）。
sen.e: The Murai family was financially well off, with a kokudaka (assessed yield) of around 16,500 koku, and Shunmoji worked on the reconstruction of Kumakabuto-jinja Shrine in the Noto territory after the death of Nagatsugu MURAI ("Toshiie MAEDA" by Yoshihiko IWASAWA etc.).

sen.j: 春香院はまつ（芳春院）34歳の末子でもあり、子供のうちで最もかわいがられたようで、春香院（おちよ：忠隆妻など、かもじ：村井妻、しゅんもじ：春香院）宛の芳春院自筆状が金沢市の加越能文庫や前田土佐守家資料館などに多く現存する。
sen.e: Shunmoji was the youngest child of Matsu (Hoshunin) at age 34 and the most loved among her children, and many notes by Hoshunin in her own handwriting addressed to Shunmoji (Ochiyo: wife of Tadataka, etc., Kamoji: wife of Murai, Shunmoji) exist in the Kaetsuno Bunko (Kaetsuno collection) and Maeda Tosanokamike Shiryokan (Museum of the Maeda family, governor of Tosa Province) in Kanazawa City.

sen.j: 春香院の再嫁は1605年とされる（『前田氏戦記集』中の「村井家伝」）が、実際に加賀の村井家に入った時期は1611年頃であった可能性が高い。
sen.e: It is believed that Shunmoji remarried in 1605 ('Records of the Murai family' in the "Maedashi senkishu" (War records of the Maeda clan)), but it is likely that the actual time that she joined the Murai family in Kaga was around 1611.

sen.j: 1600年に細川氏から離縁された後も、金沢に帰るまでは春香院は廃嫡された忠隆に付き添って京都で暮らしており、夭折した男子熊千代のほかに、徳姫（のちに左大臣西園寺実晴御台所）、吉姫、福姫（のちに京都公家・久世家初代の久世通式室）、萬姫（夭折）を生んだ。
sen.e: After being divorced from the Hosokawa clan in 1600, Shunmoji lived together with disinherited Tadataka in Kyoto, and gave birth to a boy, Kumachiyo, who died young, as well as Tokuhime (later Midaidokoro (shogun or minister's wife) of Sadaijin (minister of the left), Saneharu SAIONJI), Yoshihime, Fukuhime (later wife of Michishiki KUZE, the first of the Kuze family, a kuge (court noble) in Kyoto), and Marihime (died young).

sen.j: すなわち、春香院は細川家からは離縁されても、1611年までは忠隆（細川家を1604年廃嫡された後は長岡休無と称す）とは別れていなかったのである。
sen.e: In other words, despite being divorced from the Hosokawa family, Shunmoji did not separate from Tadataka (called Kyumu NAGAOKA after being disinherited from the Hosokawa family in 1604) until 1611.
